content:
• Monday, November 7, 2011
  • LLNW

    Content delivery and storage provider Limelight Networks (NASDAQ:LLNW) Q3 easily beats estimates...

    Content delivery and storage provider Limelight Networks (NASDAQ:LLNW) Q3 easily beats estimates on a 73% Y/Y jump in valued-added services revenue. Online video platform profits leapt 180% Y/Y, while mobile internet and tablet computing sales grew in excess of 150%. Shares +6.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:55 PM
  • LXU

    LSB Industries (NYSE:LXU) Q3 results miss both EPS and revenue estimates. Profits jumped 66%...

    LSB Industries (NYSE:LXU) Q3 results miss both EPS and revenue estimates. Profits jumped 66% Y/Y, but operating income in the manufacturing and engineering company's chemical business suffered from extended seasonal downtime. Shares -11% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:42 PM
  • HOLX

    More on Hologic (NASDAQ:HOLX): FQ4 beats Street estimates on the strength of recent acquisitions...

    More on Hologic (NASDAQ:HOLX): FQ4 beats Street estimates on the strength of recent acquisitions plus solid sales growth in all its business units. A double-digit jump in breast-health and diagnostic equipment sales helped drive a 9% Y/Y increase in revenue. Shares +3.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:34 PM
  • PKT

    Procera Networks (NYSEMKT:PKT) ramps higher in after-hours trading as its Q3 blows away...

    Procera Networks (NYSEMKT:PKT) ramps higher in after-hours trading as its Q3 blows away estimates. Revenue soared 158% Y/Y on a 360% jump in bookings for the quarter over the same period, due to a substantial increase in follow-on orders. The company also increases its FY11 revenue guidance to $40M, above Street estimates of $35M. Shares +15% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM
  • TRAK

    Title management service DealerTrack (NASDAQ:TRAK) Q3 beat estimates across the board on a jump...

    Title management service DealerTrack (NASDAQ:TRAK) Q3 beat estimates across the board on a jump in both new and used car sales as auto credit availability continues to improve. Top-line revenues were also boosted by new subscription business from to its recent acquisition of eCarlist. Shares +8.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:46 PM
  • TVIAQ

    Solazyme (SZYM) surges 17.4% AH after announcing United Airlines (NASDAQ:UAL) flew the world's...

    Solazyme (SZYM) surges 17.4% AH after announcing United Airlines (NASDAQ:UAL) flew the world's first commercial flight to use the company's algae-based jet fuel, and that it has agreed to supply up to 20M gallons/year to United starting in 2014. Solazyme also reported Q3 results after the bell (revenue of $8.9M and EPS of -$0.19 vs. consensus of $10.4M and -$0.22).

     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • HOS

    Hornbeck Offshore (NYSE:HOS) drops 6% AH after announcing a $720M plan to build 16 new offshore...

    Hornbeck Offshore (NYSE:HOS) drops 6% AH after announcing a $720M plan to build 16 new offshore supply vessels, with an option to build an additional 16 should future demand justify it. Concurrent with this move, Hornbeck is announcing it will issue 6.75M shares, plus an overallotment option of 1.01M shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • LEAF

    Demand Media (DMD) soars 17.2% AH after reporting Q3 revenue of $81.5M (+25% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    Demand Media (DMD) soars 17.2% AH after reporting Q3 revenue of $81.5M (+25% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.06, beating consensus by $3.3M and $0.02. Page views rose 21% Y/Y at company-owned sites, and 45% at partner sites. Domain name registrations rose 15%. The company expects Q4 revenue of $83M-$87M, compared with an $83.7M consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • PXD

    Oil and gas producer Pioneer Natural Resources (NYSE:PXD) drops 3% AH after announcing it will...

    Oil and gas producer Pioneer Natural Resources (NYSE:PXD) drops 3% AH after announcing it will issue 5.5M shares, along with an overallotment option of 825K shares. The company says it might use the proceeds to fund the expansion of its Wolfcamp Shale drilling efforts, and/or repay borrowings made through its credit facility.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • RPRX

    Shares of Repros Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RPRX) rocket up 13% in AH trading after the firm announces...

    Shares of Repros Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RPRX) rocket up 13% in AH trading after the firm announces data from a recent study showed a does of its Androxal treatment displays similar efficacy to similar FDA-approved testosterone-boosting gels.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • BKNG

    More on Priceline's (PCLN) Q3: Growth driven by 79% Y/Y increase in international revenue, to...

    More on Priceline's (PCLN) Q3: Growth driven by 79% Y/Y increase in international revenue, to $953M (66% of total revenue). Gross profits +65% Y/Y, outpacing revenue growth. Gross travel bookings +56% Y/Y, down from 70% in Q2. The company expects Q4 revenue to increase 27%-32% Y/Y, below a 36% consensus. It expects Q4 EPS of $4.90-$5.00, below a $5.14 consensus. PCLN +0.7% AH. (.pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • OLED

    More on Universal Display (PANL -8.9%): A policy watchdog claims a German patent panel...

    More on Universal Display (PANL -8.9%): A policy watchdog claims a German patent panel invalidated 18 of the 30 claims found in a patent related to the firm's PHOLED display technology, and instructed the company to republish the patent in a reduced form. Universal reports earnings tomorrow; expect management to discuss the issue during its CC. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • LAWS

    Lawson Products (LAWS -8.8%) takes a hit after missing Q3 estimates. Revenue was negatively...

    Lawson Products (LAWS -8.8%) takes a hit after missing Q3 estimates. Revenue was negatively impacted a system conversion that adversely affected the company's ability to replenish its distribution centers. This ultimately resulted in lower fill rates and late shipments to customers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • BBY

    Investors aren't reacting favorably to Best Buy's (BBY -3.1%) latest moves (I, II), but...

    Investors aren't reacting favorably to Best Buy's (BBY -3.1%) latest moves (I, II), but JPMorgan's Chris Horvers thinks the retailer's buyout of Carphone Warehouse's JV stake was "the right decision," given mobile's growing importance to the company as sales of other products weaken. Horvers suggests Best Buy should now focus on slashing the "real estate footprint" of its U.S. stores.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • DYN

    Dynegy's (DYN -6.2%) holding company is preparing to file for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, WSJ...

    Dynegy's (DYN -6.2%) holding company is preparing to file for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, WSJ reports, in an unusual move that could cause losses for bondholders without harming parent company shareholders.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • SSKN

    Mela Sciences (MELA +11.6%) rises after an article in Barron's over the weekend cites a Needham...

    Mela Sciences (MELA +11.6%) rises after an article in Barron's over the weekend cites a Needham analyst who says the recent FDA approval of MelaFind could push the stock as high as $20 over the next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • MTG

    Hayman Capital's Kyle Bass bought a 4.9% stake in MGIC (MTG +17.6%), according to an SEC filing,...

    Hayman Capital's Kyle Bass bought a 4.9% stake in MGIC (MTG +17.6%), according to an SEC filing, reflecting his belief that the housing market’s losses have largely been absorbed. “You can see that the pig has moved through the python in terms of U.S. housing losses." Shares could rise even if MGIC is forced by regulators to stop writing new policies, he says: "We’re in it for the long haul."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM

  • It's a big day for energy with WTI crude jumping to $95.59, its highest level since July (and...

    It's a big day for energy with WTI crude jumping to $95.59, its highest level since July (and taking heating oil with it right ahead of winter). Gold continues to churn higher, now at $1,796, a price not seen since mid-September. To Robert Sinn, the action suggests an ECB about to unleash a wave of sovereign debt monetization.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • OLED

    Cowen’s Robert Stone agrees with Canaccord’s Jonathan Dorsheimer, who wrote this...

    Cowen’s Robert Stone agrees with Canaccord’s Jonathan Dorsheimer, who wrote this morning that adoption of Universal Display's (PANL -9%) organic light-emitting diode materials by Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) for its devices’ screens does not seem imminent. But Stone parts company on prospects outside of Apple and sees intriguing prospects in television display technology.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • NBL

    Rosetta Resources (ROSE +4.6%) trades up after its Q3 EPS beat estimates earlier today. Revenue...

    Rosetta Resources (ROSE +4.6%) trades up after its Q3 EPS beat estimates earlier today. Revenue missed, but was still up over 26% Y/Y, due to the company's expansion of its Eagle Ford Shale project and a substantial increase in project drilling.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • DISH

    Though Dish Network (DISH +4.7%) is rising post-earnings (I, II), spinoff EchoStar (SATS -4.2%),...

    Though Dish Network (DISH +4.7%) is rising post-earnings (I, II), spinoff EchoStar (SATS -4.2%), which operates satellites and provides set-top boxes for Dish, is heading the other way. While revenue grew 42% Y/Y to $863M, the company reported a loss of $0.22, thanks to a 286% Y/Y increase in SG&A expenses. (10-Q)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • DWA

    DreamWorks' (DWA +9.5%) Shrek spinoff Puss in Boots remains atop the North American box office...

    DreamWorks' (DWA +9.5%) Shrek spinoff Puss in Boots remains atop the North American box office in its second weekend, taking in $33M, only a 3% drop from the $34.1M the film grossed its opening weekend, a strong hold for a non-holiday period. The movie's open had disappointed Wall Street last weekend, but bad East Coast weather may have been a factor.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • PBR

    ADRs of Petrobras (PBR +3%) trade higher on comments that it would consider selling its entire...

    ADRs of Petrobras (PBR +3%) trade higher on comments that it would consider selling its entire holding in Japanese refiner Nansei Seikyu KK - rather than just a stake in the plant as previously planned - if it had an attractive enough offer.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • ICUI

    ICU Medical (ICUI +4.7%) gains after Raymond James ups the shares to Strong Buy on valuation....

    ICU Medical (ICUI +4.7%) gains after Raymond James ups the shares to Strong Buy on valuation. The firm cites a solid Q3 and notes that the company's new product pipeline is likely to be a growth catalyst over the next few quarters.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • TKLC

    As commenter Charles A. Smith notes, Tekelec (TKLC +13.7%) shares are now changing hands roughly...

    As commenter Charles A. Smith notes, Tekelec (TKLC +13.7%) shares are now changing hands roughly 2% above the $11/share buyout price the company has agreed to. Investors are speculating a higher bid will arrive, though some think Tekelec's continued dependency on its slow-growing call-signaling business will be a deterrent.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • CHE

    Chemed (CHE +2.4%) ticks higher after its board approves an additional $100M to the current...

    Chemed (CHE +2.4%) ticks higher after its board approves an additional $100M to the current buyback program it initiated in February, as the operator of Vitas Healthcare and Roto-Rooter looks to boost the value of its stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • TESO

    Energy drilling equipment supplier Tesco (TESO -18.5%) is having a bad day following a soft Q3...

    Energy drilling equipment supplier Tesco (TESO -18.5%) is having a bad day following a soft Q3 report: Revenue of $127M (+36% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.10 missed consensus by $3.3M and $0.23. The company blames the EPS shortfall on higher-than-expected costs. Rival Newpark Resources (NR -3.9%) is also selling off.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • CLC

    CLARCOR (CLC -2.9%) trades lower after BB&T cut the shares to Hold on valuation. The stock...

    CLARCOR (CLC -2.9%) trades lower after BB&T cut the shares to Hold on valuation. The stock is currently trading near the upper end of its 52-week price range, having racked up a healthy 21% gain since late September.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • HD

    Shares of Home Depot (HD +1.7%) trade higher after RBC Capital upgrades the company to...

    Shares of Home Depot (HD +1.7%) trade higher after RBC Capital upgrades the company to Outperform from Sector Perform on top of a price target increase to $42 from $38. Analysts Scott Ciccarelli tells CNBC (video) positive industry metrics including a dollar change in private and fixed residential spending is behind the ratings boost.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • AINV

    Apollo Investments (AINV -3%) dips after Ladenburg downgrades the shares to Neutral on...

    Apollo Investments (AINV -3%) dips after Ladenburg downgrades the shares to Neutral on valuation, citing a lack of near term growth catalysts.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • NPSP

    NPS Pharmaceuticals (NPSP -3.7%) gives back all its premarket gains and more, despite the...

    NPS Pharmaceuticals (NPSP -3.7%) gives back all its premarket gains and more, despite the postive Phase 3 results for its hypoparathyroid treatment earlier today. The company has been on a steady downtrend for most of this year, losing nearly 50% since hitting a 52-week high in May.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • CCJ

    Much like fellow uranium supplier Cameco (CCJ -7.4%), USEC (USU -9.4%) is selling off following...

    Much like fellow uranium supplier Cameco (CCJ -7.4%), USEC (USU -9.4%) is selling off following a weak Q3 report. While EPS of -$0.06 beat by $0.02, revenue of $374.5M (-34% Y/Y) missed by $36.7M, as utilities pared their orders. USEC, which has $530M in debt on its balance sheet, ended Q3 with $117.9M in cash, down from $151M at the end of 2010. (CCJ Q3)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • MED

    Medifast (MED -4%) dips after Canaccord cut the shares to Hold from Buy, citing the company's...

    Medifast (MED -4%) dips after Canaccord cut the shares to Hold from Buy, citing the company's soft Q3 report last week and a lack of earnings growth going forward.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • FRO

    Frontline (FRO -3.4%) drifts lower after Deutsche lowers the shares to Hold from Buy, citing the...

    Frontline (FRO -3.4%) drifts lower after Deutsche lowers the shares to Hold from Buy, citing the company's increased risk and lower VLCC pricing and declining average spot rates.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL -10.7%) gives back Friday's gains following a downbeat note from...

    Universal Display (PANL -10.7%) gives back Friday's gains following a downbeat note from Canaccord. The firm throws cold water on hopes Apple will use Universal's OLED display technology (the result of a recent patent filing) in the near-term, and also expresses concerns about a European patent license hearing.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • RBCN

    Rubicon Technology (RBCN +7.7%) pops after Lazard ups it to Buy from Neutral, citing...

    Rubicon Technology (RBCN +7.7%) pops after Lazard ups it to Buy from Neutral, citing expectations for wafer pricing stabilization in the second half of 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • DMND

    Shares of Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) drop another 14% today after a bearish mention in Barron's...

    Shares of Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) drop another 14% today after a bearish mention in Barron's over the weekend. The article suggested the stock could get crushed if the deal to acquire the Pringles chips business from Procter & Gamble (PG +0.3%) falls apart. Last Tuesday, the company delayed the deal's closing while an audit committee investigates its walnut-crop payments to growers.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • CBRL

    Cracker Barrel (CBRL +4.6%) trades up after raising its projected FQ1 guidance on improving...

    Cracker Barrel (CBRL +4.6%) trades up after raising its projected FQ1 guidance on improving trends in same-store traffic and sales. It now expects its EPS for the quarter to come in around $0.99 - $1.04 per share, better than the $.90 per share consensus estimate.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • RST

    Rosetta Stone (RST -10.5%) extends its losses from Friday after reporting a disappointing Q3 on...

    Rosetta Stone (RST -10.5%) extends its losses from Friday after reporting a disappointing Q3 on weak bookings. The stock has netted a 32% loss over just the past two sessions, and is down over 70% since hitting its 52-week high in November of last year.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • SOL

    ReneSola (SOL -4.6%) trades lower after the struggling solar manufacturer cuts its Q3 guidance...

    ReneSola (SOL -4.6%) trades lower after the struggling solar manufacturer cuts its Q3 guidance for revenue and shipments due to continued weak demand and industry oversupply. The company now says it expects to post a loss for the period, seeing revenue between $185M-$195M, down from $220M-$240M previously expected.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO +1.6%), everyone's favorite M&A rumor mill, trades higher after the FT reports...

    Yahoo (YHOO +1.6%), everyone's favorite M&A rumor mill, trades higher after the FT reports the company "has edged closer towards a potential sale of all or part of the company" to PE firms. It's added that a Yahoo proposal to sell a mere minority stake and leave management in control "has raised only lukewarm interest," not to mention agitated Dan Loeb.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • VRTX

    Pharma Wars: Shares of Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -7.9%) and Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN...

    Pharma Wars: Shares of Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -7.9%) and Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN -5.4%) move lower after separate announcements from Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS +2.2) and Inhibitex (INHX +14.3%) on drug treatments look set to affect sales for the firms of their competing products. Trading volume on all four companies is high.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • KWK

    Oil-and-gas explorer Quicksilver Resources (KWK -6.3%) takes a hit after its Q3 EPS misses the...

    Oil-and-gas explorer Quicksilver Resources (KWK -6.3%) takes a hit after its Q3 EPS misses the mark on higher operational expenses. Revenue beat as earnings rose 32% on higher natural-gas-liquid and oil prices, but operating margins dropped to 26.2% versus 27.4% as the company ramps up its oil and liquids exploration efforts.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • NAT

    Nordic American Tankers (NAT -3.2%) dips after reporting its Q3 loss widened as spot shipping...

    Nordic American Tankers (NAT -3.2%) dips after reporting its Q3 loss widened as spot shipping rates dropped by more than half. Virtually all of the company's fleet is exposed to spot rates. The average daily rate fell 52% to $8,000 from the prior quarter. Net voyage revenue also dropped 56% to $11.2M, while operating expenses rose by 4.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM | 2 Comments
  • ARIA

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA -12.3%) dives after an abstract from the American Society of...

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA -12.3%) dives after an abstract from the American Society of Hematology indicates 17% of chronic myeloid lukemia patients using Ariad's Ponatinib drug experienced serious side effects, and 15% of patients stopped using the drug.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM | 4 Comments
  • CDE

    Coeur d'Alene Mines (CDE +5.1%) shoots higher after reporting Q3 results. Revenue of $343.6M...

    Coeur d'Alene Mines (CDE +5.1%) shoots higher after reporting Q3 results. Revenue of $343.6M (+49% Y/Y) beat by $58.4M, while EPS of $0.35 missed by $0.34. Silver production rose 3% Q/Q, while gold production declined slightly. Like many other miners, Coeur d'Alene has a history of reporting earnings that diverge widely from Street estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • LL

    Hardwood flooring retailer Lumber Liquidators (LL +4.2%) jumps after Goldman Sachs ups its...

    Hardwood flooring retailer Lumber Liquidators (LL +4.2%) jumps after Goldman Sachs ups its rating on the stock to Neutral. Goldman says it expects earnings growth for the company to exceed 20% over the next three quarters, driven improved same-store sales trends and gross margin expansion.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • FTK

    Shares of Flotek (NYSE:FTK) gain 9.5% on heavy volume in advance of its earnings report slated...

    Shares of Flotek (NYSE:FTK) gain 9.5% on heavy volume in advance of its earnings report slated to be released on Wednesday. The company has also been a target of persisting M&A chatter, helping drive up shares 62% over the last month.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • CRNT

    Though rival Ceragon (CRNT -15.1%) is getting clocked following its Q3 report, DragonWave (DRWI...

    Though rival Ceragon (CRNT -15.1%) is getting clocked following its Q3 report, DragonWave (DRWI +3.2%) is rising on an upgrade to Buy from Jefferies. The firm believes DragonWave's recent acquisition of Nokia Siemens' (NOK, SI) wireless backhaul business will create a "huge revenue opportunity in Western and Southern Europe," as 4G LTE network rollouts take off in 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • BPZ

    BPZ Resources (BPZ -4.2%) trades lower on a Rodman & Renshaw downgrade to Market Perform....

    BPZ Resources (BPZ -4.2%) trades lower on a Rodman & Renshaw downgrade to Market Perform. The firm say BPZ continues to suffer from setbacks in its Peruvian operations, and likely faces another year of limited growth in FY12.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +0.6%) spikes a little after officially unveiling its anticipated Nook...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +0.6%) spikes a little after officially unveiling its anticipated Nook Tablet. Spec-wise, the Nook Tablet has an edge on Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) Kindle Fire: the device is lighter, sports twice as much memory, and features a high-quality IPS LCD display. But will that be enough to offset Amazon's edge in pricing and (potentially) apps?

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 2 Comments
  • IBI

    Interline Brands (IBI -6.4%) trades lower after William Blair cuts the shares to Market Perform,...

    Interline Brands (IBI -6.4%) trades lower after William Blair cuts the shares to Market Perform, citing increasing competition, poor growth prospects, and constraints on its operating leverage.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • CRNT

    Ceragon Networks (CRNT -15.9%), a maker of mobile backhaul infrastructure gear, gets crushed...

    Ceragon Networks (CRNT -15.9%), a maker of mobile backhaul infrastructure gear, gets crushed after reporting Q3 results. While revenue of of $116.1M (+86% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.02 beat consensus by $2.1M and $0.01, the company is forecasting revenue will grow "at a slower pace than originally expected," due to macro uncertainty and Indian regulatory issues.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 2 Comments
  • AAN

    Aaron's (AAN -3.3%) trails off after announcing CEO Robert Loudermilk has resigned due to health...

    Aaron's (AAN -3.3%) trails off after announcing CEO Robert Loudermilk has resigned due to health reasons. An analyst with Gilford Securities says the company won't suffer from the unexpected development, pointing to its deep pool of talent.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • DISH

    Dish Network (DISH +3.4%) is trading higher in spite of missing Q3 estimates. Shares are...

    Dish Network (DISH +3.4%) is trading higher in spite of missing Q3 estimates. Shares are likely reacting to the company's declaration of a one-time dividend of $2/share (payable Dec. 1). Investors might also be pleased with a modest improvement in the company's subscriber loss rate (111K in Q3 vs. 135K in Q2).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • HMSY

    HMS Holdings (HMSY +9.1%) gains after announcing it will acquire privately-held...

    HMS Holdings (HMSY +9.1%) gains after announcing it will acquire privately-held HealthDataInsights for ~$400M in a merger that is expected to close before the end of the year. The healthcare benefits and services provider says the deal will add $85M to revenue in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • NUAN

    Shares of Transcend Services (TRCR) fall 9.8% after the firm misses Q3 earnings estimates by a...

    Shares of Transcend Services (TRCR) fall 9.8% after the firm misses Q3 earnings estimates by a penny and advises that it saw a higher-than-normal attrition rate during the period. The medical transcription company says about the half of the annual revenue lost is attributable to a customer that it acquired.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • VHC

    VirnetX (VHC +2.6%) catches a bid after stating it has filed a complaint against Apple...

    VirnetX (VHC +2.6%) catches a bid after stating it has filed a complaint against Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) with the ITC over the alleged infringement of a patent it was recently awarded. The patent covers a means of securely transmitting information between devices using VPN technology. (USPTO filing)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • NOK

    Citigroup cuts Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -6.5%) to Sell from Neutral, citing lack of visibility and...

    Citigroup cuts Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -6.5%) to Sell from Neutral, citing lack of visibility and expectations for further financial disappointment. ALU also was downgraded to Sell from Reduce at WestLB. Shares fell 16.7% Friday after the company reported weak Q3 results and lowered guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • LUK-OLD

    Jefferies (JEF +4.3%) rises after announcing it has cut its long and short holdings of Euro...

    Jefferies (JEF +4.3%) rises after announcing it has cut its long and short holdings of Euro sovereign debt by $1.1B apiece from Friday levels - a reduction of 49.5%. The firm says its net long exposure to the asset class is now just $59M... though the devil may be in the details.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM | 2 Comments
  • AMGN

    Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN) gains 5.1% on news that the biotech giant will repurchase $5B in shares via...

    Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN) gains 5.1% on news that the biotech giant will repurchase $5B in shares via a Dutch tender offer at a price between $54 and $60.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM
  • BAYRY

    Bayer AG (OTCPK:BAYRY) receives FDA approval for its Xarelto blood thinner treatment. The...

    Bayer AG (OTCPK:BAYRY) receives FDA approval for its Xarelto blood thinner treatment. The company says a required warning that patients should consult their doctors if they want to stop taking the drug because of an increased risk of strokes "could be lifted" when a new study is completed. Shares up 2.8% in Frankfurt trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • CVC

    Calevision (NYSE:CVC) +2.6% premarket after an article in Barron's over the weekend suggests...

    Calevision (NYSE:CVC) +2.6% premarket after an article in Barron's over the weekend suggests selling is overdone and the company could be a takeover target.
